channel.title: Using wireless connection
channel.description:
Ok, So, i have signed up to no-ip and download ip-duc and ticked the box next to the domain ect. Then it says - If you have wireless your done??
Whats the next step.... Do i just RUN the source and it magically appears on my No-IP domain?!? or is there another wireless step to it????!?
NOTE: I am using "Mobile Boradband" so it is wireless however you still need a mobile broadband USB stick in your computer.

item.title: Using wireless connection
item.dc:creator: @pure2ownage Pure_
item.description:
@pure2ownage wrote:

no bro don’t.
them mobile broadbands are like 300kb internet sticks of shit.

Read full topic

item.title: Using wireless connection
item.dc:creator: @unleashed_pvp unleashed pvp
item.description:
@unleashed_pvp wrote:

Dude i have wireless and i have to portforward its realy easy and loom up a tutorial what ever router you got or go to http://portforward.com/ Thats how i portforward my server hope it helped.

Read full topic

item.title: Using wireless connection
item.dc:creator: @Shorty626 Shorty626
item.description:
@Shorty626 wrote:

Chances are you wont be able to host a server at all because the service provider isn’t just going to leave ports unfiltered. You can’t alter their firewall, and if you did they probably wouldn’t appreciate it too much.

Read full topic

item.title: Using wireless connection
item.dc:creator: @MobilScape MobilScape
item.description:
@MobilScape wrote:

That is my question! When you are using wireless… you dont have to portforward.

However, do they class Wireless as Mobile Broadband… and if so… i wont have to portforward.

Read full topic

item.title: Using wireless connection
item.dc:creator: @Shorty626 Shorty626
item.description:
@Shorty626 wrote:

Well I don’t recommend you host shit over mobile broadband because you are going to piss off your ISP. On the other hand its probably filtered if you are using the mobile broadband the way I’m understanding it. you haven’t said anything about port forwarding so I can guess that would be your next step.

Read full topic
